Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that "all the books" have been removed from the classrooms, when in fact it was only outdated library books that were removed.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a Facebook post and does not provide any additional evidence or sources.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the reason for removing the books is because they "cannot be cleaned" due to COVID-19 restrictions, without providing any evidence or confirmation of this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why the books were removed, such as the need to update the library collection to align with curriculum and student needs.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the books were not contaminated by the coronavirus and were instead outdated library books.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by including unrelated comments about the coronavirus and Chinese virus, which do not provide any relevant information or support for the claim.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
